title: Taliban bans radio broadcasts of Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty in Afghanistan
description: The Taliban’s ministry of information and culture issued a ban, which went into effect on Thursday, December 1, 2022, removing the stations from AM and FM transmission networks. The statements said the Taliban received unspecified complaints about the outlets' programming content.

title: Macron takes aim at Musk for cutting back Twitter moderation
description: The French president demanded an increase in regulation rather than the reductions being enforced by Twitter's new CEO.

title: Brussels court struggles to select jury for 2016 attacks trial
description: Starting Monday, the jury will be hearing the trial of 10 defendants accused of being behind two attacks that killed 32 people and injured 340 in the Belgian capital.

title: The divorce between Donald Trump and Rupert Murdoch is complete
description: The conservative billionaire, owner of Fox News and 'The Wall Street Journal,' is turning away from the former president of the United States and openly siding with Florida Governor Ron DeSantis.

title: Turkish President Erdogan's electoral base is disillusioned
description: The supporters of the Justice and Development Party (AK) are disappointed by the government's poor economic record and its authoritarian shift.

title: Biden and Macron pledge 'unwavering' alliance under cloud of trade dispute
description: The French president pulled no punches as he criticized his American counterpart's green policy, claiming it would 'kill' European jobs.

title: EU seeks special court to try Putin, Russian officials over Ukraine war
description: Based on the European Commission's assessment, the International Criminal Court in The Hague does not have the right to prosecute Russia for its 'crime of aggression' against Ukraine.

title: John McFall, the first 'para-astronaut' in history?
description: Having lost his right leg after a motorcycle accident, this British surgeon and former Paralympic athlete has joined the European Space Agency's new training program. His goal is to become the first disabled man to go into space.

title: Bidens welcome France with red, white and blue state dinner
description: It's the first state dinner since 2019 and the first for President Joe Biden.

title: World Cup 2022: France files complaint over disallowed goal
description: Antoine Griezmann's refused goal against Tunisia on Wednesday sparked another video refereeing controversy.

title: Olympics mean no Paris finish for 2024 Tour de France
description: It's the first time in over 100 years that the race will not finish in the French capital.

title: Google appeals huge Android antitrust fine to EU's top court
description: It's the largest-ever antitrust fine issued by the European Commission.

title: 'The inscription of the baguette in the UNESCO heritage list is an appalling regression'
description: American historian Steven Kaplan, the author of numerous books on bread, regrets that a generic product that is already losing ground in the country is being celebrated.

title: TikTok used to promote Russian mercenary group Wagner
description: A report published on Thursday points to the presence of numerous publications on the social media platform glorifying the actions of Russian militiamen.

title: Western-supplied Ukrainian artillery is breaking down
description: Maintenance centers have been set up in Slovakia and Poland to repair some equipment damaged in part by Russian missiles.

title: In Washington, Macron goes on the offensive for Europe
description: While visiting the United States, the French president attacked the American anti-inflation plan, which is considered protectionist in France.

title: World Cup 2022: France's substitutes miss opportunity as Tunisia upset Les Bleus but fail to qualify
description: In a World Cup match with nothing at stake for France, the coach made nine changes; beaten 1-0, the starting line-up was completely open.

title: What you need to know about PrEP, the HIV/AIDS prevention pill
description: On the occasion of World AIDS Day on December 1, 'Le Monde' reports on the preventive treatment for HIV-negative people who are at high risk of exposure.

title: France sees hottest year on record in 2022
description: Even if December is very cold, this year will be the hottest for the country since records began in 1990, according to France's national weather service.

title: EU commission recommends funding freeze for Hungary
description: EU member states have until December 19 to vote on whether to back, reject or change the recommendation.

title: German parliament labels 1930s Ukraine famine as 'genocide'
description: The resolution was adopted with the votes of the three parties in Chancellor Olaf Scholz's governing coalition and the main opposition bloc.

title: In the US Senate, Republicans join forces with Democrats to protect same-sex marriage
description: The bill is expected to move quickly to President Joe Biden for his signature after a vote in the House of Representatives.

title: China signals zero-Covid relaxation after protests
description: The southern manufacturing hub Guangzhou has partially lifted a weeks-long lockdown.

title: 'Heir' Rahul Gandhi's long march to unite India
description: At 52 years old, the political dynasty descendant is walking across the country on foot to reconnect with the Indian population – and restore his past credibility, undermined by electoral defeats.

title: Mass vaccination of the elderly, a possible way out for China's zero-Covid policy
description: Ninety-seven percent of people over 60 would need three doses of the vaccine for the Chinese health system not to be overwhelmed by the lifting of this increasingly criticized policy.

title: France continues to export ultra-toxic pesticides despite ban
description: This year France became the first country to ban the export of pesticides prohibited in Europe, but loopholes have allowed agrochemical giants to continue this controversial trade.

title: World Cup 2022, a football tournament with a pan-Arab festival flair
description: From the stadium stands to the streets of the Qatari capital, the international sporting event has turned into a brotherly reunion for the populations of the Levant, the Maghreb, and the Gulf, too often separated by borders and conflicts.

title: House Democrats elect Hakeem Jeffries minority leader
description: New York representative Hakeem Jeffries was elected on Wednesday, November 30, head of the Democratic party in Congress. He will become the minority leader in January after Speaker Nancy Pelosi announced that she would step aside.

title: Emmanuel Macron blasts Joe Biden subsidies in state visit
description:
The French president raised concerns about the effects of American industrial subsidies and tax breaks to members of Congress in Washington on Wednesday, November 30, 2022. France and other EU countries are alarmed that the Inflation Reduction Act will 
give American companies an unfair advantage.
